intro: Hieracium closianum, commonly known as the close thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from June to August. Hieracium closianum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
